text: Dear all, does anyone have an idea how to get to the HTML code from the drag and drop emails? I can’t find them in the Design Manager.
Hi Patrick, this is not supported at the moment but it is next in our road map to investigate it.
<@U01QW45AR0Q> Is the fabled drag and drop custom coded modules which can also be extended with a custom base template?
Yes we will investigate a solution to allow adding drag and drop areas to coded templates in a similar way pages does.

What are the considerations? I know it’s not as simple as this but I see it as simple as ‘copy and paste’ but in a graphical way?

I code blocks - you produce little rectangles which the user can drag in any order, and as many as they like.

It’s my job as a developer to make sure the HTML doesn’t break so no need for any server side processing or crufty code.
The only issue for me is how to identify each block, naming is hard! Would be nice if there was a way to capture a screenshot of each module as it would render in a finished email.

Steven I understand this might look like a simple task, but we already know this will impact our rendering, saving and email editor heavily, so it requires investigation and a large amount of work for the team. There will be a lot to consider to make sure the experience for both developers and editor users will be good. Please send me you're portal ids privately, I'll take a note to add your portals to the beta when it will be available

I’m an email developer so I don’t have access save for which client I’m working with at the time!

I do use the free CRM so feel free to activate it on there if that’s at all possible (better email should be in Marketing Starter at least!)
Unfortunately coded emails and coded modules are only supported in professional and enterprise at the moment
Such a shame, I do hope real email is made available to lower tiers at some point - especially if there’s a d&d to go with it!
I love to see the interest for this in free and starter! Thank you for all the very valuable feedback, I will take a note of all this and discuss these points with the team.

Hi <@U038J8BRR24>! You can follow <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/how-do-i-get-the-html-of-an-email-i-sent-from-HubSpot|this KB >to get the HTML code of a drag & drop email. As Alex mentioned, it's not editable this way. It's just a way to export the code.
Thanks for the quick and helpful responses!
